newsitem.title: USA: Union Pacific Resources finds gas in USG.
newsitem.headline: Union Pacific Resources finds gas in USG.

text.p: Union Pacific Resources Group Inc announced an offshore natural gas discovery in Ship Shoal block 105 in the central Gulf of Mexico.
The well has five separate productive sands which represent more than 100 feet of net pay. Union Pacific said it is the operator and owns a 58 percent working interest in the well.
Union Pacific plans to spend up to $25 million net to drill as many as three more wells in this area during the third and fourth quarter of this year.
The new wells will be drilled to test additional potentially productive formations which have been identified by 3-D seismic.
At least one of the new wells will be on an adjacent location owned 100 percent by Union Pacific.
Production facilities are expected to be completed by fourth quarter 1997 in order to accommodate the production from the Ship Shoal 105 well and the pending wells.
